professional_title: Registered Nurse - Critical Care & Emergency Medicine
professional_summary: Compassionate and detail-oriented Registered Nurse with 12+ years of experience in high-acuity environments including Emergency Department, Intensive Care Unit, and Trauma. Advanced expertise in critical care, emergency response, patient advocacy, and interdisciplinary collaboration. Proven ability to remain calm under pressure while providing exceptional patient care. Strong clinical assessment skills with focus on evidence-based practice and continuous quality improvement. Committed to patient safety, education, and achieving optimal health outcomes.

work_experience.job_title: Critical Care Registered Nurse - Medical/Surgical ICU
work_experience.description: Provide comprehensive nursing care to critically ill patients with complex medical conditions in 24-bed MICU with 1:2 nurse-to-patient ratio (occasionally 1:3 during surge situations)
key_responsibilities: Manage patients requiring mechanical ventilation, continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT), hemodynamic monitoring via arterial lines and Swan-Ganz catheters, vasopressor support, and advanced cardiac life support
Serve as preceptor for 15+ new graduate nurses and nursing students, providing clinical education, skill development, and mentorship transitioning into critical care practice

Member of Unit-Based Council focused on improving patient outcomes and nurse satisfaction; led initiative reducing catheter-associated urinary tract infections (CAUTIs) by 45% through education and protocol implementation (2022-2023)
Participate in interdisciplinary rounds with physicians, respiratory therapists, pharmacists, social workers, and case managers to develop comprehensive patient care plans
Demonstrate proficiency with Epic EHR system for documentation, medication administration, and care coordination
Consistently receive excellent patient satisfaction scores (95th percentile) and peer recognition for clinical excellence
Float to other ICU units (SICU, CCU, Neuro ICU) as needed based on hospital census and staffing requirements

work_experience.description: Delivered rapid assessment and emergency care in high-volume Level I Trauma Center ED averaging 350+ patient visits daily
key_responsibilities: Performed triage assessment using ESI (Emergency Severity Index) 5-level triage system, prioritizing patients based on acuity and resource needs
Managed diverse patient population including trauma, cardiac emergencies, stroke, respiratory distress, sepsis, overdose, pediatric emergencies, and psychiatric crises
Initiated treatment protocols for time-sensitive conditions (STEMI, stroke, sepsis) ensuring door-to-intervention times met national benchmarks
Collaborated with trauma team during resuscitation of critically injured patients; assisted with emergency procedures including chest tube insertion, intubation, central line placement
Served as charge nurse 2-3 shifts per month, overseeing department operations, staff assignments, patient flow, and resource allocation
Received "Daisy Award for Extraordinary Nurses" (Q2 2018) for compassionate care and clinical excellence

work_experience.description: Provided specialized cardiac nursing care for patients with acute myocardial infarction, heart failure, arrhythmias, and post-cardiac catheterization/intervention
key_responsibilities: Monitored continuous cardiac telemetry, recognized life-threatening arrhythmias, and initiated appropriate interventions per ACLS protocols
Administered cardiac medications including thrombolytics, inotropes, antiarrhythmics, and anticoagulants with meticulous attention to dosing and patient response
Educated patients and families regarding heart disease, lifestyle modifications, medication compliance, and cardiac rehabilitation
Participated in unit quality improvement project that reduced heart failure readmission rates by 22% through enhanced discharge planning and patient education

work_experience.description: Completed 12-month nurse residency program for new graduates with structured orientation, skills development, and progressive independence
key_responsibilities: Cared for adult patients with variety of medical-surgical conditions in 32-bed unit with typical patient ratio of 1:5-6
Developed foundational nursing skills including medication administration, wound care, patient assessment, IV therapy, and documentation
Attended weekly residency seminars covering topics such as time management, critical thinking, professional development, and evidence-based practice

honors: Sigma Theta Tau International Honor Society of Nursing (inducted 2010)

volunteer_experience.organization: Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program
volunteer_experience.description: Provide health screenings and basic care at community health events twice monthly; Offer health education and resource navigation for vulnerable populations
Provided primary care and health education in underserved rural communities
